{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient presents with increasing shortness of breath on exertion, which is suggestive of a cardiac etiology. On physical examination, there are multiple murmurs heard, including an early diastolic blowing, decrescendo murmur at the left sternal border, a midsystolic murmur at the right upper sternal border, and a late diastolic rumbling murmur at the apex.
